newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK OCT 96 C/A DEFICIT RISES 11PCT TO $696 MLN.
newsitem.headline: GREEK OCT 96 C/A DEFICIT RISES 11PCT TO $696 MLN.

text.p: rose provisionally to $696 million in October 1996 from $626.9
million in the same month of 1995 and the January-October
deficit jumped 41 percent to $4.318 billion, the Bank of Greece
The widening of the current account deficit in the first
eight months of 1996 reflects a larger trade deficit by $952.4
and a smaller invisibles surplus by $302.8 million, it said.
The trade deficit fell slightly to $1.680 billion in October
1996 from $1.701 billion in the same month of 1995. The
cumulative January-October trade deficit rose 6.7 percent to
But net private capital inflows soared to $6.987 billion in

Forex reserves stood at $20.5 billion at the end of January
